        <item>
          <title>San Jose Sharks rout Nashville Predators in Game 7</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/san-jose-sharks-rout-nashville-predators-in-game-7.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">46342c0d-fd21-4feb-9607-ace3e18448aa</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:49:18 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/san-jose-sharks-rout-nashville-predators-in-game-7/goal.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>San Jose will open the Western Conference final on the road Sunday against the St. Louis Blues.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Josh Dubrow - The Associated Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/san-jose-sharks-rout-nashville-predators-in-game-7/goal.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/san-jose-sharks-rout-nashville-predators-in-game-7/goal.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The Sharks' Logan Couture buries the puck past Nashville goalie Pekka Rinne during second-period play Thursday night in San Jose.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Ben Margot</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Thunder silence Spurs, advance to Western Conference final</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/basketball/2016/05/12/thunder-silence-spurs-advance-to-western-conference-final.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">e061f68b-8e7d-4ad1-b27c-5bd06baf89bc</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:11:36 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/basketball/2016/05/12/thunder-silence-spurs-advance-to-western-conference-final/duncan.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Oklahoma City will face defending NBA champion Golden State in the Western final, starting Monday in Oakland.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Cliff Brunt - The Associated Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/basketball/2016/05/12/thunder-silence-spurs-advance-to-western-conference-final/duncan.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/basketball/2016/05/12/thunder-silence-spurs-advance-to-western-conference-final/duncan.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Thunder forward Kevin Durant, left, has a few words with Spurs' Tim Duncan after Oklahoma City eliminated San Antonio from the post-season.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Alonzo Adams</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Connors lead charge as Marlies down Devils in Game 5</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/connors-lead-charge-as-marlies-down-devils-in-game-5.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">b021526f-5534-4aad-b432-f4a1cd840694</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:29:27 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/connors-lead-charge-as-marlies-down-devils-in-game-5/marlies.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Connor Carrick and Connor Brown had back-to-back power-play goals as the Marlies beat the Albany Devils 5-1.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            The Canadian Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/connors-lead-charge-as-marlies-down-devils-in-game-5/marlies.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/connors-lead-charge-as-marlies-down-devils-in-game-5/marlies.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Marlies goalie Antoine Bibeau stopped 21 of 22 Albany shots to earn his fourth win of the post-season on Thursday night.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Rick Madonik</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Playoff basketball all about scratching, clawing your way to top: Feschuk</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/playoff-basketball-all-about-scratching-clawing-your-way-to-top-feschuk.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">9762b975-c076-4255-a99d-a1324c1c26e6</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:46:02 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/playoff-basketball-all-about-scratching-clawing-your-way-to-top-feschuk/biyombo.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Clawing and scratching, figurative and otherwise, has certainly been a big part of these games between the Raptors and the Heat. Bismack Biyombo, for one, can attest to that painful truth.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Dave Feschuk - Sports Columnist</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/playoff-basketball-all-about-scratching-clawing-your-way-to-top-feschuk/biyombo.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/playoff-basketball-all-about-scratching-clawing-your-way-to-top-feschuk/biyombo.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The Raptors' Bismack Biyombo is no stranger to the dangers of life in the trenches, especially come playoff time. And he has the bloody scratches and gouges to prove it.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Nathan Denette</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Raptors-Miami Heat: Game 6 game preview</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-miami-heat-game-6-game-preview.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">342289b8-0400-4c34-a438-80c2c4a0588d</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:52:24 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-miami-heat-game-6-game-preview/nba.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Game 7, if necessary, is Sunday at 3:30 p.m., at the Air Canada Centre.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Chris O’Leary - Sports Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-miami-heat-game-6-game-preview/nba.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-miami-heat-game-6-game-preview/nba.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The Raptors' Norman Powell can expect to see plenty of Miami's Dwyane Wade in Game 6 Friday night, particularly if DeMarre Carroll is slowed by his wrist injury.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Frank Gunn</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>The good, the bad and the zany of the MLB so far</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/baseball/2016/05/12/the-good-the-bad-and-the-zany-of-the-mlb-so-far.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">978ff5e0-7d69-4f1c-bad7-e72116d7d2cc</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:26:33 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/baseball/2016/05/12/the-good-the-bad-and-the-zany-of-the-mlb-so-far/price.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Early-season baseball highlights, from hot young pitchers and rising strikeout rates to Bartolo’s bomb and Price’s poor ERA.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Mark Zwolinski - Sports reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/baseball/2016/05/12/the-good-the-bad-and-the-zany-of-the-mlb-so-far/price.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/baseball/2016/05/12/the-good-the-bad-and-the-zany-of-the-mlb-so-far/price.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>After signing a $217-million contract over the winter, Boston Red Sox pitcher David Price has the third-worst ERA in the league so far.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Michael Dwyer</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Canada’s Eugenie Bouchard loses to Barbora Strycova at Italian Open</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/tennis/2016/05/12/canadas-eugenie-bouchard-loses-to-barbora-strycova-at-italian-open.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">c527983c-9777-4ad2-98fc-06b63cde5f4c</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:06:51 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/tennis/2016/05/12/canadas-eugenie-bouchard-loses-to-barbora-strycova-at-italian-open/bouchard-lossjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Bouchard lost to the Czech Republic player in the third round of the Italian Open.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            The Canadian Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/tennis/2016/05/12/canadas-eugenie-bouchard-loses-to-barbora-strycova-at-italian-open/bouchard-lossjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/tennis/2016/05/12/canadas-eugenie-bouchard-loses-to-barbora-strycova-at-italian-open/bouchard-lossjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Eugenie Bouchard fell to Barbora Strycova of the Czech Republic in a third-round loss at the Italian Open.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Clive Brunskill</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Getty Images</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Canada put to test against Germany at world hockey championship</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/canada-put-to-test-against-germany-at-world-hockey-championship.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">2971bd49-0849-4302-a664-4e0d55402eeb</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:39:44 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/canada-put-to-test-against-germany-at-world-hockey-championship/canada.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Taylor Hall scored twice Thursday as Canada earned its fourth straight win at the tournament, surviving a second-period scare in a 5-2 victory over Germany.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Carl Schram - The Canadian Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/canada-put-to-test-against-germany-at-world-hockey-championship/canada.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/canada-put-to-test-against-germany-at-world-hockey-championship/canada.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Canada's Taylor Hall, right, tangles with Germany's Marcus Kink during world championship play on Thursday in St. Petersburg, Russia.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Dmitri Lovetsky</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Miami Heat ready to put chill on Raptors’ plans to advance</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/miami-heat-ready-to-put-chill-on-raptors-plans-to-advance.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">ff146622-b877-48c1-936f-23844bbccebf</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:21:13 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/miami-heat-ready-to-put-chill-on-raptors-plans-to-advance/dengjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>The Heat, as beaten up as the Toronto Raptors, face another post-season elimination game Friday night at the American Airlines Arena.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Doug Smith - Sports Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/miami-heat-ready-to-put-chill-on-raptors-plans-to-advance/dengjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/miami-heat-ready-to-put-chill-on-raptors-plans-to-advance/dengjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Miami's Luol Deng is listed as questionable for Friday’s game with a bruised left wrist. The Raptors can eliminate the Heat from the post-season with a Game 6 victory in Miami.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Alan Diaz</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>The science behind Marcus Stroman’s stellar sinker</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/the-science-behind-marcus-stromans-stellar-sinker.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">44e04da8-07cd-45f5-8f71-6e81e004c81f</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:04:35 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/the-science-behind-marcus-stromans-stellar-sinker/stroman.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Stroman’s sinking, two-seam fastball has made him one of Major League Baseball’s best ground-ball pitchers.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Brendan Kennedy - Sports reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/the-science-behind-marcus-stromans-stellar-sinker/stroman.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/the-science-behind-marcus-stromans-stellar-sinker/stroman.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Marcus Stroman's money pitch is his sinker, and it's among the best if not the best in the majors. Stroman’s sinker drops more than any other in the big leagues, and nearly four inches more than the league-average sinker.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Carlos Osorio</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Jays’ Marcus Stroman evokes comparisons to Roy Halladay</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/jays-marcus-stroman-evokes-comparisons-to-roy-halladay.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">873a2fe3-224a-486e-bba0-7349248b5138</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:42:53 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/jays-marcus-stroman-evokes-comparisons-to-roy-halladay/halladay.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>By leaning on his sinker as his primary pitch, Marcus Stroman is following in the footsteps of another Blue Jays ace: Roy Halladay.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Brendan Kennedy - Sports reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/jays-marcus-stroman-evokes-comparisons-to-roy-halladay/halladay.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/jays-marcus-stroman-evokes-comparisons-to-roy-halladay/halladay.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Former Jays ace Roy Halladay boasted a world-class sinker, something current Jays starter Marcus Stroman also has in repetoire.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Fred Thornhill</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Thumbs up to Raptors’ DeMar DeRozan and the red shoestring</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/thumbs-up-to-raptors-demar-derozan-and-the-red-shoestring.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">781e56e1-c395-4b30-88b6-4944d1af1fb5</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:36:19 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/thumbs-up-to-raptors-demar-derozan-and-the-red-shoestring/dero.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>The red shoestring Raptors director of sports science Alex McKechnie spun around DeRozan’s injured thumb in Game 5 was a popular topic of conversation on Thursday.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Chris O’Leary - Sports Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/thumbs-up-to-raptors-demar-derozan-and-the-red-shoestring/dero.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/thumbs-up-to-raptors-demar-derozan-and-the-red-shoestring/dero.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>DeMar DeRozan had his injured thumb wrapped in a red shoestring in Game 5 on Wednesday night. It was unconventional to say the least, but it worked.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Blue Jays-Texas Rangers: Series preview</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/blue-jays-texas-rangers-series-preview.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">264f9c6b-7624-4470-976e-22598a893e5a</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:24:31 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/blue-jays-texas-rangers-series-preview/mazara.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>The Jays continue their week-long road trip in Arlington against Nomar Mazara and the Texas Rangers.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Brendan Kennedy - Sports reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/blue-jays-texas-rangers-series-preview/mazara.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/bluejays/2016/05/12/blue-jays-texas-rangers-series-preview/mazara.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Rangers right fielder Nomar Mazara leads all American League rookies with a .359 on-base percentage.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Tony Gutierrez</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>NHL playoffs OT games ending more quickly than usual</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/nhl-playoffs-ot-games-ending-more-quickly-than-usual.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">73266eba-f4ed-4ccb-807f-10d537523d24</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:51:15 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/nhl-playoffs-ot-games-ending-more-quickly-than-usual/jason-garrison.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Second round of this year’s post-season has featured a record nine overtime games going into Thursday.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Stephen Whyno - The Associated Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/nhl-playoffs-ot-games-ending-more-quickly-than-usual/jason-garrison.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/hockey/2016/05/12/nhl-playoffs-ot-games-ending-more-quickly-than-usual/jason-garrison.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Tampa Bay Lightning defenceman Jason Garrison (5) and left wing Ondrej Palat (18) celebrate after Garrison scored the winning-goal in overtime against New York Islanders goalie Thomas Greiss (1) in  Game 4 of the NHL hockey Stanley Cup Eastern Conference semifinals, Friday, May 6, 2016, in New York. The Lightning won 2-1.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Frank Franklin II</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Russian state-run doping program fuelled Olympic gold, insider says</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/2016/05/12/russian-state-run-doping-program-fuelled-olympic-gold-insider-says.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">a13b721f-d67a-43c0-98d5-0b5ee8ee9165</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:31:00 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/2016/05/12/russian-state-run-doping-program-fuelled-olympic-gold-insider-says/skiing.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Whistleblower alleges dozens of Russian athletes have a state-run doping program to thank for their Olympic success.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            REBECCA R. RUIZ, MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ - The New York Times</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/2016/05/12/russian-state-run-doping-program-fuelled-olympic-gold-insider-says/skiing.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/2016/05/12/russian-state-run-doping-program-fuelled-olympic-gold-insider-says/skiing.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Dozens of Russian athletes at the games, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program, according to the director of the country's anti-doping laboratory at the time.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">CHANG W. LEE</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">NYT</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Canada’s downhill racer Larisa Yurkiw retires after best season of career</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/amateur/2016/05/12/canadas-downhill-racer-larisa-yurkiw-retires-after-best-season-of-career.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">41741353-b9b8-40c5-bc46-890f160db45f</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:16:12 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2016/05/12/canadas-downhill-racer-larisa-yurkiw-retires-after-best-season-of-career/larissa-yurkiw.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Yurkiw says the price her surgically repaired knees would have to pay to get to South Korea in 2018 would be too high.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Donna Spencer - The Canadian Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2016/05/12/canadas-downhill-racer-larisa-yurkiw-retires-after-best-season-of-career/larissa-yurkiw.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2016/05/12/canadas-downhill-racer-larisa-yurkiw-retires-after-best-season-of-career/larissa-yurkiw.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Catastrophic injuries to Larisa Yurkiw's right knee sustained in a 2009 crash kept her from racing at the 2010 Winter Games and for almost two years after that. Now she says the price of her injuries will be too much to prepare for the 2018 Olympic Games in South Korea.

</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">ARND WIEGMANN</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">REUTERS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Raptors’ DeMarre Carroll confident he’ll play Game 6 vs. Heat</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-update-status-of-demarre-carroll.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">1d588735-4e82-43bb-adf6-195d2d2473b3</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:39:09 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-update-status-of-demarre-carroll/demarre-carroll.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Forward initially thought he broke his wrist but tests came back negative, club lists forward as questionable.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Chris O’Leary - Sports Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-update-status-of-demarre-carroll/demarre-carroll.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2016/05/12/raptors-update-status-of-demarre-carroll/demarre-carroll.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Toronto Raptors have listed DeMarre Carroll as questionable for Game 6 after suffering a wrist injury Wednesday night.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Frank Gunn</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS FILE PHOTO</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Brazil Olympic Games will be just fine says IOC President Bach</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/2016/05/12/brazil-olympic-games-will-be-just-fine-says-ioc-president-bach.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">53d11d08-54cc-43b4-a665-bac725dd5ccf</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:28:12 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/2016/05/12/brazil-olympic-games-will-be-just-fine-says-ioc-president-bach/bach.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff’s impeachment won’t hinder success of Rio de Janeiro Olympics, says IOC’s President Thomas Bach
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Associated Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/2016/05/12/brazil-olympic-games-will-be-just-fine-says-ioc-president-bach/bach.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/2016/05/12/brazil-olympic-games-will-be-just-fine-says-ioc-president-bach/bach.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>IOC President Thomas Bach says Brazil's political crisis won't affect the Olympic Games.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">DENIS BALIBOUSE</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">REUTERS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Albany’s Dan Kelly suspended, won’t play in playoffs vs. Marlies</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/albanys-dan-kelly-suspended-wont-play-in-playoffs-vs-marlies.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">e1ce430a-7e77-4226-b51c-8967a792a755</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:17:14 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/albanys-dan-kelly-suspended-wont-play-in-playoffs-vs-marlies/dan-kelly.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>AHL bans defenceman for 10 games for vicious elbow to Toronto forward Andreas Johnson’s head.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Mark Zwolinski - Sports reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/albanys-dan-kelly-suspended-wont-play-in-playoffs-vs-marlies/dan-kelly.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2016/05/12/albanys-dan-kelly-suspended-wont-play-in-playoffs-vs-marlies/dan-kelly.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Albany Devils defenceman Dan Kelly (right) seen here last week battling with the Marlies' Josh Leivo, has been suspended 10 games by the AHL for a vicious elbow to Toronto forward Andreas Johnson’s head Tuesday.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star file photo</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
